subject: Sleep
title: Can Any Animal Skip Sleep?
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Can Any Animal Skip Sleep?.

hook.text: Scientists have searched for an animal that doesn't sleep. After studying thousands of species, they've found none.

buildup.text: Some species were once thought sleepless: bullfrogs, certain fish, and some sharks. All were later shown to sleep.

discovery.text: Even nematode worms with just 302 neurons show a sleep-like state called lethargus during development.

twist.text: The bullfrog myth came from a 1967 study that only measured one response type. Later studies found clear sleep.

climax.text: Sleep appears to be a universal requirement of all nervous systems, with no known biological exceptions.

punchline.text: No animal has escaped the need for sleep. Not a single one.

quiz.question: Has any animal been proven to not need sleep?
options: No, every animal studied has been found to sleep
